cab.content: Printed for the Cabinet, July, 1924. SECRET.Copy No. 3 9CP. 440 (24).THE CABINET.CHEMICAL WARFARE POLICY.MEMORANDUM BY THE SECRETARY OF STATE FOR WAR.I desire to draw the attention of my colleagues to the following recommeudation 0153 of the Committee of Imperial Defence (183rd Meeting) : 4964" (1) That His Majesty's Government should approve the adoption of a formula, which should serve as the basis of the policy of this country in regard to research work in connection with gas warfare, similar to the formula, which has already been adopted by the French Government and included as a foreword at the beginning of the French Field Service Regulations ('Instructions provisoires sur 1'Emploi tactique des grandes Unites'), the formula in question reading as follows : " Respecting the international engagements to which France has sub-scribed, the French Government will endeavour at the beginning of a war, and in agreement with its allies, to obtain from the enemy Government an \engagement not to use offensive gas as a weapon of war. If this engage-ment is not obtained, the French Government will reserve its liberty to act according to circumstances."II (2) That the War Office should be authorized to insert a paragraph on the lines ofthe above-mentioned formula in the Field Service Regulations and such other training manuals of-the British Army as may appear desirable."I do not wish to trouble the Cabinet by asking that the matter be put on the Agenda Paper, and propose to give effect to the recommendation, unless any of my colleagues intimate their objection within the course of the next few clays."S.
